name.namePart: National Society of The Colonial Dames of America in Tennessee

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Wilkins Tannehill in his later years, with a full head of grey hair, seated on a red chair and wearing a burgundy and gold Masonic stole. Wilkins Tannehill was born in 1787 in Pennsylvania and died in 1858 in Nashville. He was a merchant, banker, writer, editor, and Masonic leader, and he served as Nashville's Mayor from 1825-1827. He married Eliza Dewees in 1810. Oil on canvas. Presented to the library in January 1966 by Tannehill's great-grandson, Wilkins Tannehill Bayless. The portrait is currently on display in the Nashville Room on the Nashville Public Library's second floor. The portrait was painted by a family member, Frances Elizabeth Bayless Willett, around 1914 and modeled after the original done by Washington B. Cooper around 1840, 1852, or 1859. The original is held by the Grand Lodge of Tennessee Free and Accepted Masons, 100 7th Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37203. The library's portraits were photographed as part of the National Society of The Colonial Dames of America in Tennessee's Tennessee Portrait Project (http://www.tnportraits.org/index.htm).
